item.title: Marginal distributions with ggplot2 and patchwork
item.description: patchwork packages is a great tool to assemble ggplot2 object. I made a Japanese slide to introduce patchwork package in Tokyo R meeting. Here, I tried to produce marginal plots, but failed because I was using plot arithmetics (| and /). library(ggplot2) library(patchwork) xy <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(wt, mpg)) + geom_point() x <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(wt)) + geom_histogram(bins = 30) y <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg)) + geom_histogram(bins = 30) + coord_flip() (x | plot_spacer()) / (xy | y) I just found that wrap_plots() helps.
